items.content: The Trump administration has built up military forces in the Caribbean including the deployment of the USS Gerald R. Ford and its carrier strike group.

items.title: U.S. military seizes 2 oil tankers linked to Venezuela
items.standfirst: The U.S. carried out operations Wednesday to seize the oil tankers Marinera and Sophia, officials announced.
items.content: The U.S. carried out operations Wednesday to seize the oil tankers Marinera and Sophia, officials announced.

items.title: Rubio says U.S. will control money from sales of Venezuelan oil
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told reporters that the U.S. has a three-phase plan for Venezuela, with an initial emphasis on stabilizing the country.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told reporters that the U.S. has a three-phase plan for Venezuela, with an initial emphasis on stabilizing the country.

items.title: U.S. seizes oil tankers; Rubio says U.S. will control money from oil sales
items.standfirst: The U.S. carried out operations Wednesday to seize two Venezuela-linked tankers, and Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the U.S. has "tremendous leverage" over the country.
items.content: The U.S. carried out operations Wednesday to seize two Venezuela-linked tankers, and Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the U.S. has "tremendous leverage" over the country.

items.title: Rubio to meet Danish officials next week over US interest in Greenland
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Wednesday he will meet with Danish officials next week amid rising fears that Washington plans to seize the world's largest island by force.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Wednesday he will meet with Danish officials next week amid rising fears that Washington plans to seize the world's largest island by force.

items.title: Rubio and Hegseth brief lawmakers on "three fold process" for Venezuela
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth briefed lawmakers Wednesday on a three-fold process for Venezuela's future.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth briefed lawmakers Wednesday on a three-fold process for Venezuela's future.(Image credit: Heather Dieh)

items.title: White House says millions of Venezuelan oil barrels will arrive to the U.S. "very soon" after deal
items.standfirst: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt assured reporters that there is a detailed plan for the future of Venezuela, adding that millions of oil barrels that President Trump has alluded to will reach the U.S. "very soon." CBS News' Aaron Navarro and Charlie D'Agata report.
items.content: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt assured reporters that there is a detailed plan for the future of Venezuela, adding that millions of oil barrels that President Trump has alluded to will reach the U.S. "very soon." CBS News' Aaron Navarro and Charlie D'Agata report.

items.title: US will control Venezuela oil sales 'indefinitely', official says
items.standfirst: Officials say sales were expected to start with 30 million to 50 million barrels of oil and the revenue would be controlled by the US government.
items.content: Officials say sales were expected to start with 30 million to 50 million barrels of oil and the revenue would be controlled by the US government.

items.title: Marco Rubio says he will meet Danish officials to discuss Greenland next week
items.standfirst: Remarks by US secretary of state come after Greenland and Denmark request urgent meeting over Trump threatsEurope live – latest updatesThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, says he plans to meet Danish officials next week to discuss Greenland as a crisis escalates within Nato over Donald Trump’s threats to take over the Arctic territory.An urgent meeting had been requested by the foreign ministers of Greenland and Denmark, which has said that any invasion or seizure of the territory by its Nato ally would mark the end of the western military alliance and “post-second world war security”. Continue reading...
items.content: Remarks by US secretary of state come after Greenland and Denmark request urgent meeting over Trump threatsEurope live – latest updatesThe US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, says he plans to meet Danish officials next week to discuss Greenland as a crisis escalates within Nato over Donald Trump’s threats to take over the Arctic territory.An urgent meeting had been requested by the foreign ministers of Greenland and Denmark, which has said that any invasion or seizure of the territory by its Nato ally would mark the end of the western military alliance and “post-second world war security”. Continue reading...

items.title: Denmark, Greenland Seek Urgent Talks With Rubio Over Trump Remarks
items.standfirst: Denmark and Greenland have requested urgent talks with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio after President Donald Trump renewed public remarks about acquiring Greenland. Danish lawmakers said Greenland is not for sale and warned that talk of acquisition, especially without ruling out military…
items.content: Denmark and Greenland have requested urgent talks with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio after President Donald Trump renewed public remarks about acquiring Greenland. Danish lawmakers said Greenland is not for sale and warned that talk of acquisition, especially without ruling out military…

items.title: What are Trump’s real options for gaining control of Greenland?
items.standfirst: The White House has said using the US military is always an option, but few analysts believe it a likely oneEurope live – latest updatesThe Trump administration has said repeatedly that the US needs to gain control of Greenland, a mineral-rich, largely self-governing part of Denmark with foreign and security policy run from Copenhagen.The White House has said using the US military is “always an option”, but few analysts believe an armed operation is likely and France’s foreign minister has said the US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has ruled out the possibility of an invasion. Continue reading...
items.content: The White House has said using the US military is always an option, but few analysts believe it a likely oneEurope live – latest updatesThe Trump administration has said repeatedly that the US needs to gain control of Greenland, a mineral-rich, largely self-governing part of Denmark with foreign and security policy run from Copenhagen.The White House has said using the US military is “always an option”, but few analysts believe an armed operation is likely and France’s foreign minister has said the US secretary of state, Marco Rubio, has ruled out the possibility of an invasion. Continue reading...

items.title: Karoline Leavitt defends Venezuela operation and Greenland pursuit in White House press briefing
items.standfirst: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt defended the U.S military action in Venezuela and the Trump administration's pursuit of Greenland in a press briefing on Wednesday. CBS News Aaron Navarro and Charlie D'Agata have more.
items.content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt defended the U.S military action in Venezuela and the Trump administration's pursuit of Greenland in a press briefing on Wednesday. CBS News Aaron Navarro and Charlie D'Agata have more.

items.title: Democrats decry Venezuela attack as Republicans defend Trump after Senate briefing
items.standfirst: Top Trump officials briefed 100 US senators on weekend raid while defending military operation and US presidentTop officials from the Trump administration arrived on Capitol Hill this morning to defend one of the most audacious military operations in recent US history: the forcible capture of a sitting head of state from his own capital.Secretary of state Marco Rubio, defense secretary Pete Hegseth, attorney general Pam Bondi, CIA director John Ratcliffe and Gen Dan Caine, chair of the joint chiefs of staff, briefed all 100 US senators on Operation Absolute Resolve, the lightning raid that plucked the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, from his Caracas residence and deposited him in a New York City jail cell. Continue reading...
items.content: Top Trump officials briefed 100 US senators on weekend raid while defending military operation and US presidentTop officials from the Trump administration arrived on Capitol Hill this morning to defend one of the most audacious military operations in recent US history: the forcible capture of a sitting head of state from his own capital.Secretary of state Marco Rubio, defense secretary Pete Hegseth, attorney general Pam Bondi, CIA director John Ratcliffe and Gen Dan Caine, chair of the joint chiefs of staff, briefed all 100 US senators on Operation Absolute Resolve, the lightning raid that plucked the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, from his Caracas residence and deposited him in a New York City jail cell. Continue reading...

items.title: US seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker in Atlantic after two-week pursuit
items.standfirst: US European Command says it boarded the Marinera over alleged sanctions violations, a move that risks confrontation with MoscowEurope live – latest updatesThe US has seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the Atlantic Ocean in a high-stakes operation that could risk confrontation with the Kremlin after Moscow reportedly dispatched a submarine to safeguard the vessel.US European Command said on Wednesday that it had boarded the Marinera over alleged sanctions violations, bringing to an end a dramatic two-week pursuit that began in the Caribbean and concluded in the Atlantic. Continue reading...
items.content: US European Command says it boarded the Marinera over alleged sanctions violations, a move that risks confrontation with MoscowEurope live – latest updatesThe US has seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the Atlantic Ocean in a high-stakes operation that could risk confrontation with the Kremlin after Moscow reportedly dispatched a submarine to safeguard the vessel.US European Command said on Wednesday that it had boarded the Marinera over alleged sanctions violations, bringing to an end a dramatic two-week pursuit that began in the Caribbean and concluded in the Atlantic. Continue reading...

items.title: How could Donald Trump 'take' Greenland?
items.standfirst: The White House says it is considering a range of options to take the island, including deploying the military.
items.content: The White House says it is considering a range of options to take the island, including deploying the military.

items.title: US military says it has seized two sanctioned oil tankers
items.standfirst: The United States said on Wednesday it had seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the North Atlantic and a second oil tanker in the Caribbean. US officials said both of the vessels are part of a so-called shadow fleet that has carried oil for countries such as Venezuela, Russia and Iran in violation of US sanctions.
items.content: The United States said on Wednesday it had seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the North Atlantic and a second oil tanker in the Caribbean. US officials said both of the vessels are part of a so-called shadow fleet that has carried oil for countries such as Venezuela, Russia and Iran in violation of US sanctions.

items.standfirst: US officials say they’ve taken control of two oil tankers linked to Venezuela in the Atlantic and the Caribbean.
items.content: US officials say they’ve taken control of two oil tankers linked to Venezuela in the Atlantic and the Caribbean.

items.title: US seizes Russian tanker in Atlantic
items.standfirst: Interception follows failure of bid to capture vessel as it headed to Venezuela last month
items.content: Interception follows failure of bid to capture vessel as it headed to Venezuela last month

items.title: Buy or invade? Trump weighs options to take control of Greenland
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump says he is considering “a range of options” to acquire Greenland for national security reasons, with reports that the White House discussed scenarios including military action. Danish, Greenlandic and European leaders have firmly rejected the idea, stressing international law and insisting that Greenland is not for sale.
items.content: US President Donald Trump says he is considering “a range of options” to acquire Greenland for national security reasons, with reports that the White House discussed scenarios including military action. Danish, Greenlandic and European leaders have firmly rejected the idea, stressing international law and insisting that Greenland is not for sale.

items.title: Rubio lays out Venezuela plan focused on stabilization, recovery and transition
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio laid out a "three-fold process" for Venezuela focused on stabilization, recovery and transition. Rubio also confirmed that the U.S. will sell 30 to 50 million barrels of Venezuelan oil. NBC News' Monica Alba reports on the plan detailed by Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio laid out a "three-fold process" for Venezuela focused on stabilization, recovery and transition. Rubio also confirmed that the U.S. will sell 30 to 50 million barrels of Venezuelan oil. NBC News' Monica Alba reports on the plan detailed by Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

items.title: Venezuela cooperating on US-seized oil tankers, says Marco Rubio
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth have addressed journalists following the US army's seizure of two Venezuela-linked tanker and Donald Trump's reiterated remarks that the United States should take over Greenland, a territory that is part of the kingdom of Denmark. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle analyses their comments.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth have addressed journalists following the US army's seizure of two Venezuela-linked tanker and Donald Trump's reiterated remarks that the United States should take over Greenland, a territory that is part of the kingdom of Denmark. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle analyses their comments.

items.title: Replay: U.S. Secretaries of State and Defence address Venezuela, Greenland
items.standfirst: Rewatch as U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and U.S. Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth journalists as the U.S. has reiterated demands to take over Greenland and seized two Venezuela-linked oil tankers.
items.content: Rewatch as U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and U.S. Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth journalists as the U.S. has reiterated demands to take over Greenland and seized two Venezuela-linked oil tankers.

items.title: U.S. seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker with ties to Venezuela
items.standfirst: U.S. forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic after a two week chase. This is part of the larger U.S. campaign aimed at tankers going to and from Venezuela.
items.content: U.S. forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic after a two week chase. This is part of the larger U.S. campaign aimed at tankers going to and from Venezuela.

items.title: France working with allies on plan should US move on Greenland
items.standfirst: France is working with partners on a plan on how to respond should the United States act ⁠on its threat to take over Greenland, a minister said on January 7, as Europe sought to address U.S. President Donald Trump's ambitions in the region. This comes as the White House has said that it is looking at buying the territory, and that military action is possible. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle breaks it down for us.
items.content: France is working with partners on a plan on how to respond should the United States act ⁠on its threat to take over Greenland, a minister said on January 7, as Europe sought to address U.S. President Donald Trump's ambitions in the region. This comes as the White House has said that it is looking at buying the territory, and that military action is possible. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle breaks it down for us.

items.title: US seizes two sanctioned Venezuela-linked oil tankers as blockade 'in full effect'
items.standfirst: The U.S. has seized two sanctioned oil tankers linked to Venezuela in back-to-back actions in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean. This comes after US President Donald Trump announced that a deal had been struck with interim leader Delcy Rodriguez to send tens of millions of barrels of oil to the US. According to US media, Washington has also reportedly demanded that Caracas meet the White House's demands before being allowed to pump more oil, including exporting heavy crude oil exclusively to the US, and severe economic ties with Iran, China and Russia.
items.content: The U.S. has seized two sanctioned oil tankers linked to Venezuela in back-to-back actions in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean. This comes after US President Donald Trump announced that a deal had been struck with interim leader Delcy Rodriguez to send tens of millions of barrels of oil to the US. According to US media, Washington has also reportedly demanded that Caracas meet the White House's demands before being allowed to pump more oil, including exporting heavy crude oil exclusively to the US, and severe economic ties with Iran, China and Russia.

items.title: Do Russia and China pose a national security threat to the US in Greenland?
items.standfirst: White House says President Donald Trump still wants to buy Greenland, but has said military means are an option, too.
items.content: White House says President Donald Trump still wants to buy Greenland, but has said military means are an option, too.

items.title: New video said to show US forces shadowing Russian oil tanker
items.standfirst: Video released by Russian state media is said to show a US coast guard vessel shadowing a Russian-flagged oil tanker.
items.content: Video released by Russian state media is said to show a US coast guard vessel shadowing a Russian-flagged oil tanker.

items.title: US Congress divided over Maduro capture and future of US in Venezuela
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio briefed leaders in Congress late January 5 on the striking military operation in Venezuela, amid mounting concerns that President Donald Trump is embarking on a new era of U.S. expansionism without consultation with lawmakers. After the briefing, Republican House Speaker Mike Johnson emphasised that U.S. actions in Venezuela are “not a regime change” operation... but democratic leaders said the Trump administration lacked a clear plan for running the country.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio briefed leaders in Congress late January 5 on the striking military operation in Venezuela, amid mounting concerns that President Donald Trump is embarking on a new era of U.S. expansionism without consultation with lawmakers. After the briefing, Republican House Speaker Mike Johnson emphasised that U.S. actions in Venezuela are “not a regime change” operation... but democratic leaders said the Trump administration lacked a clear plan for running the country.

items.title: Why does Donald Trump want to take over Greenland?
items.standfirst: Denmark and Greenland are seeking a meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio after the Trump administration doubled down on its intention to take over the strategic Arctic island, a self-governing Danish territory. Tensions escalated after the White House said Tuesday that the “U.S. military is always an option,” even as a series of European leaders rejected President Donald Trump’s renewed demands. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into how serious these threats could be.
items.content: Denmark and Greenland are seeking a meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio after the Trump administration doubled down on its intention to take over the strategic Arctic island, a self-governing Danish territory. Tensions escalated after the White House said Tuesday that the “U.S. military is always an option,” even as a series of European leaders rejected President Donald Trump’s renewed demands. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into how serious these threats could be.

items.title: US military seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker in North Atlantic
items.standfirst: The US on Wednesday seized a Russian oil tanker in the North Atlantic that officials said was part of a shadow fleet carrying oil in violation of US sanctions. The US military had pursued the Marinera tanker, formerly named the Bella-1, from the coast of Venezuela, capturing it shortly before seizing a second sanctioned tanker in the Caribbean.
items.content: The US on Wednesday seized a Russian oil tanker in the North Atlantic that officials said was part of a shadow fleet carrying oil in violation of US sanctions. The US military had pursued the Marinera tanker, formerly named the Bella-1, from the coast of Venezuela, capturing it shortly before seizing a second sanctioned tanker in the Caribbean.

items.title: U.S. secures oil tanker linked to Venezuela, officials say
items.standfirst: U.S. officials told NBC News that an operation was launched to seize a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the northern Atlantic that is linked to Venezuela. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports on why the U.S. views the ship as stateless.
items.content: U.S. officials told NBC News that an operation was launched to seize a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the northern Atlantic that is linked to Venezuela. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports on why the U.S. views the ship as stateless.

items.title: US takeover of Greenland would 'simply mean the end of NATO', says Denmark
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump is discussing options including military action to take control of Greenland, the White House said on January 7, upping tensions that Denmark warns could destroy the NATO alliance. Denmark has warned any move to take Greenland by force would mean "everything would stop," including NATO and 80 years of close transatlantic security links. FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali looks into the issue for us.
items.content: US President Donald Trump is discussing options including military action to take control of Greenland, the White House said on January 7, upping tensions that Denmark warns could destroy the NATO alliance. Denmark has warned any move to take Greenland by force would mean "everything would stop," including NATO and 80 years of close transatlantic security links. FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali looks into the issue for us.

items.title: U.S. military action an option to acquire Greenland, White House says
items.standfirst: The White House said Tuesday that acquiring Greenland is a "national security priority" and that using the U.S. military to achieve that goal is under consideration.“President Trump has made it well known that acquiring Greenland is a national security priority of the United States, and it’s vital to deter our adversaries in the Arctic region,” White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said in a statement.“The President and his team are discussing a range of options to pursue this imp

clusters.title: Yemen separatist leader to make last stand after rejecting Saudi ultimatum, supporters say
clusters.neutral_headline: Yemen separatist leader accused of treason as Saudi Arabia strikes forces

items.title: Yemen separatist leader to make last stand after rejecting Saudi ultimatum, supporters say
items.standfirst: Saudi airstrikes hit Aidarous al-Zubaidi’s military camps after he defies a demand to travel to Riyadh for talksThe leader of Yemen’s routed southern separatist movement, Aidarous al-Zubaidi, has decided to make a defiant last stand in Aden, his supporters say, rejecting a Saudi ultimatum to travel to Riyadh for talks and – for now – a plan to flee the southern capital.Al-Zubaidi, the president of the Southern Transitional Council (STC), has been gathering his remaining troops in Aden as rival Saudi-backed forces seek to take control of Aden. His supporters said his mood was to fight it out although he knew it was likely there would be an attempt to kill him. Continue reading...
items.content: Saudi airstrikes hit Aidarous al-Zubaidi’s military camps after he defies a demand to travel to Riyadh for talksThe leader of Yemen’s routed southern separatist movement, Aidarous al-Zubaidi, has decided to make a defiant last stand in Aden, his supporters say, rejecting a Saudi ultimatum to travel to Riyadh for talks and – for now – a plan to flee the southern capital.Al-Zubaidi, the president of the Southern Transitional Council (STC), has been gathering his remaining troops in Aden as rival Saudi-backed forces seek to take control of Aden. His supporters said his mood was to fight it out although he knew it was likely there would be an attempt to kill him. Continue reading...

Warner’s leadership has repeatedly rebuffed Skydance-owned…

Warner’s leadership has repeatedly rebuffed Skydance-owned…

items.title: Warner Bros rejects Paramount takeover again and tells shareholders to stick with Netflix bid
items.standfirst: Warner’s leadership has rebuffed Paramount’s overtures again and urged shareholders to back the sale of its streaming and studio business to Netflix for $72 billion. Warner expressed concerns that the Paramount bid would essentially be a leveraged buyout, which includes a lot of debt. A merger with either company could take over a year to close — and will attract tremendous antitrust scrutiny along the way. FRANCE 24's Yuka Royer takes a look.
items.content: Warner’s leadership has rebuffed Paramount’s overtures again and urged shareholders to back the sale of its streaming and studio business to Netflix for $72 billion. Warner expressed concerns that the Paramount bid would essentially be a leveraged buyout, which includes a lot of debt. A merger with either company could take over a year to close — and will attract tremendous antitrust scrutiny along the way. FRANCE 24's Yuka Royer takes a look.

clusters.title: RFK Jr.'s new food pyramid puts meat, cheese and vegetables at the top
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump administration releases updated dietary guidelines: ‘Eat real food’

items.title: RFK Jr.'s new food pyramid puts meat, cheese and vegetables at the top
items.standfirst: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has announced new dietary guidelines for Americans focused on promoting whole foods, healthy proteins and fats. And he's 'declared war' on sugar.
items.content: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has announced new dietary guidelines for Americans focused on promoting whole foods, healthy proteins and fats. And he's 'declared war' on sugar.(Image credit: U.S. Department of Agriculture)

items.title: Trump administration releases updated dietary guidelines: ‘Eat real food’
items.standfirst: New guidance presented by Robert F Kennedy Jr prioritizes protein, healthy fats and ‘declares war on added sugar’The Trump administration has released updated dietary guidelines for Americans on Wednesday that emphasize eating whole and minimally processed foods, scaling back refined carbohydrates, and “declaring war” on added sugars.The recommendations encourage “prioritizing high-quality protein, healthy fats, fruits, vegetables and whole grains” while steering clear of highly processed foods. Robert F Kennedy Jr, the health and human services (HHS) secretary, and Brooke Rollins, the agriculture secretary, are presenting the new guidance at a White House briefing. Continue reading...
items.content: New guidance presented by Robert F Kennedy Jr prioritizes protein, healthy fats and ‘declares war on added sugar’The Trump administration has released updated dietary guidelines for Americans on Wednesday that emphasize eating whole and minimally processed foods, scaling back refined carbohydrates, and “declaring war” on added sugars.The recommendations encourage “prioritizing high-quality protein, healthy fats, fruits, vegetables and whole grains” while steering clear of highly processed foods. Robert F Kennedy Jr, the health and human services (HHS) secretary, and Brooke Rollins, the agriculture secretary, are presenting the new guidance at a White House briefing. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Brigitte Bardot's funeral takes place as Saint-Tropez bids adieu to cinema icon
clusters.neutral_headline: Brigitte Bardot's funeral takes place as Saint-Tropez bids adieu to cinema icon

items.title: Brigitte Bardot's funeral takes place as Saint-Tropez bids adieu to cinema icon
items.standfirst: Brigitte Bardot's funeral was held on January 7 with a private service and a public homage in Saint-Tropez, the French Riviera resort where she lived for more than half a century after retiring from movie stardom at the height of her fame. Hundreds of people gathered in the small town to follow the farewell on large screens set up at the port and on two plazas.
items.content: Brigitte Bardot's funeral was held on January 7 with a private service and a public homage in Saint-Tropez, the French Riviera resort where she lived for more than half a century after retiring from movie stardom at the height of her fame. Hundreds of people gathered in the small town to follow the farewell on large screens set up at the port and on two plazas.

items.title: Video shows security forces firing tear gas at protesters as Iran crackdown kills dozens
items.standfirst: Protesters in Iran defied authorities Tuesday, hitting the streets in the capital, Tehran, and smaller cities to chant anti-government slogans amid an ongoing violent crackdown that one human rights group says has left at least 36 dead
items.content: Protesters in Iran defied authorities Tuesday, hitting the streets in the capital, Tehran, and smaller cities to chant anti-government slogans amid an ongoing violent crackdown that one human rights group says has left at least 36 dead

items.title: Iranian security forces clash with protesters at Tehran’s grand bazaar
items.standfirst: Nationwide protests continue to grow as rights groups accuse authorities of cracking down on demonstratorsIranian security forces have clashed with protesters staging a sit-in at Tehran’s grand bazaar, firing teargas and expelling demonstrators as the nationwide protest movement continued to grow in its 10th day.The violence on Tuesday at a location that carries historical symbolism as an activist hub during the country’s 1979 revolution comes as rights groups accuse authorities of cracking down on protesters. Continue reading...
items.content: Nationwide protests continue to grow as rights groups accuse authorities of cracking down on demonstratorsIranian security forces have clashed with protesters staging a sit-in at Tehran’s grand bazaar, firing teargas and expelling demonstrators as the nationwide protest movement continued to grow in its 10th day.The violence on Tuesday at a location that carries historical symbolism as an activist hub during the country’s 1979 revolution comes as rights groups accuse authorities of cracking down on protesters. Continue reading...
